body.p: The CZT project consists of the following subprojects:

section.p: ZML defines an XML markup for Z specifications.
Most of the other subprojects depend directly or indirectly on this subproject since the AST Java classes in Corejava are generated from the ZML Schema using the code generator GnAST.

Corejava contains AST (Annotated Syntax Tree) classes for standard Z, Object Z, and TCOZ written in Java. It is closely related to ZML since most of the classes and interfaces in this subproject are automatically generated from the XML Schema using the code generator GnAST.

section.title: Gaffe
section.p: This is a GUI builder for Z animators.

section.title: GnAST
section.p: This is a code generator that generates Java interfaces and classes (for instance, the AST in Corejava) from an XML Schema.
Note that GnAST is not (yet) designed to be released. It is used internally by CZT developers to generate code for other subprojects of CZT. However, the source code is available via CVS.

section.title: JEdit plugins
section.p: This is a collection of tools, modes and plugins for the JEdit editor which provide support for editing Z specifications.

Parser contains parser and printer utilities for standard and Object Z specifications written in unicode or using latex markup. Support for e-mail markup as well as TCOZ is planned. The output of the parser is an AST (see Corejava) and can be written as an XML file, using the ZML format.

section.title: ZLive
section.p: This is an animator for Z.

section.title: ZMLTP
section.p: This is a ZML to HTML transformer.
